description: '''Alfred McCoy Tyner''' (December 11, 1938{{spnd}}March 6, 2020) was an American [[jazz piano|jazz pianist]] and composer known for his work with the [[John Coltrane]] Quartet from 1960 to 1965, and his long solo career afterwards. He was an [[NEA Jazz Masters|NEA Jazz Master]] and five-time [[Grammy]] Award winner. Tyner has been widely imitated, and is one of the most recognizable and influential jazz pianists of all time.
